sentences.en: He commenced blubbering himself, and hurried out to hide his cowardly agitation.
sentences.cn: 他自己也开始哭起来, 又连忙跑出去去掩盖他那怯弱的感情.

sentences.en: He thought it would be cowardly to draw back.
He thought the letter cowardly and hypocritical.
sentences.cn: 他认为这封信写得既怯懦又伪善.

sentences.en: He was weak, cowardly and treacherous.
I was too cowardly to complain.
I'm cowardly about things that remind me of myself.
sentences.cn: 我对那些使我回忆起往事的东西总感到胆怯.
管理部门软弱无力、胆小怕事.

sentences.en: That was sporting of him. Or should I say cowardly.
sentences.cn: 他风格真高。或者我是否应该说他很懦弱？
这一懦怯的攻击把她打垮了.

sentences.en: The cowardly officer was disgraced for failing to do his duty.
sentences.cn: 这卑怯的官员因不尽职而被解职.

sentences.en: The trouble is, people are so cowardly - won't face the facts.
sentences.cn: 麻烦的是人们都是那样胆小― ― 不愿面对现实.

sentences.en: There's something cowardly and ignoble about such an attitude.
sentences.cn: 这种态度有点怯懦可鄙.

sentences.en: They are cowardly, and are always anticipating danger.
sentences.cn: 他们胆小怯懦, 总是提防着危险.

sentences.en: They felt he had been cowardly in manipulating the system to avoid the draft.
sentences.cn: 他们觉得他太没种，居然钻漏洞逃避服役。

sentences.en: This was a cowardly thing to do.
sentences.cn: 做这种事是懦弱的行为。

sentences.en: We shall unmask that cowardly cheat.
sentences.cn: 我们要拆穿那个卑劣骗子的假面具.

trans.tran_en: If you describe someone as cowardly, you disapprove of them because they are easily frightened and avoid doing dangerous and difficult things
